feed.title: Space-schedule
feed.subtitle: All items in subcategories for category.

entry.title: NG-16 Cygnus Release & Reentry
entry.content: The Northrop Grumman NG-16 Cygnus will be unberthed from the ISS before initiating a destructive reentry into the Earth's atmosphere taking waste along with it.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-2 "Endeavour" Crew Dragon Splashdown
entry.content: The "Endeavour" Crew Dragon will splashdown in the Gulf of Mexico, bringing NASA astronauts Shane Kimbrough and Megan McArthur, JAXA astronaut Akihiko Hoshide and ESA astronaut Thomas Pesquet back to Earth after spending six months on the International Space Station.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-2 "Endeavour" Crew Dragon Undocking
entry.content: The "Endeavour" Crew Dragon will undock from the International Space Station, carrying NASA astronauts Shane Kimbrough and Megan McArthur, JAXA astronaut Akihiko Hoshide and ESA astronaut Thomas Pesquet. It will then reenter the Earth's atmosphere and splashdown in the Atlantic Ocean.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-3 Crew Dragon Docking
entry.content: The Crew-3 Crew Dragon will dock autonomously to the International Space Station, carrying NASA astronauts Raja Chari, Thomas Marshburn and Kayla Barron as well as ESA astronaut Matthias Maurer to the International Space Station as crew members of Expedition 66.

entry.title: Falcon 9 Block 5 | SpX USCV-3 (NASA Crew Flight 3)
entry.content: Third crewed operational flight of a Crew Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station as part of NASA's Commercial Crew Program.

entry.title: Progress MS-18 Docking
entry.content: The Progress MS-18 spacecraft is scheduled to autonomously dock to the Zvezda module of the ISS.

entry.title: Soyuz 2.1a | Progress MS-18 (79P)
entry.content: The Progress MS-18 spacecraft will resupply the International Space Station.

entry.title: H-IIA 202 | QZS-1R
entry.content: The Quasi-Zenith Satellite System (QZSS) is a three-satellite regional time transfer system and the satellite-based augmentation system for the GPS that would be receivable within Japan. The primary purpose of QZSS is to increase the availability of GPS in Japan's numerous urban canyons, where only satellites at very high elevation can be seen. A secondary function is performance enhancement, increasing the accuracy and reliability of GPS derived navigation solutions. QZS-1R is a replacement satellite for QZS-1 which was launched in 2010.

entry.title: Ariane 5 ECA | SES-17 & Syracuse 4A
entry.content: SES-17 is a Ka-band high-throughput geostationary communications satellite built by Thales Alenia Space designed to provide mobile internet services to airline passengers over the Americas and the Atlantic Ocean. Syracuse 4A is a French military communications satellite built by Thales Alenia Space.

entry.title: Progress MS-17 Relocation
entry.content: The Progress MS-17 spacecraft will be relocated from the Poisk module to the Nauka module.

entry.title: Soyuz MS-18 Landing
entry.content: The Soyuz MS-18 spacecraft carrying ROSCOSMOS cosmonaut Oleg Novitskiy as well as film director Klim Shipenko and actress Yulia Peresild will land back on Earth near Dzhezkazgan, Kazakhstan.

entry.title: Soyuz MS-18 Undocking
entry.content: The Soyuz MS-18 spacecraft will undock from the International Space Station carrying Expedition 65 crew member ROSCOSMOS cosmonaut Oleg Novitskiy as well as film director Klim Shipenko and actress Yulia Peresild.

entry.title: Atlas V 401 | Lucy
entry.content: Lucy is the first mission to explore and study Trojan asteroids. The Trojans are a type of asteroids that orbit the Sun in two groups, in front of and behind Jupiter in its orbit around our star. Since these asteroids have been in such stable orbits for billions of years, they are of great interest as remnants of early Solar System. Lucy is a NASA mission led by NASA Goddard and Southwest Research Institute in Boulder, Colorado. Over the course of 12 years, Lucy will fly by seven different Trojan asteroids and also one main belt asteroid. The complex trajectory to visit all targets will include several Earth gravity assists.

entry.title: Long March 2F/G | Shenzhou 13
entry.content: Second crewed flight to the Chinese Tiangong space station carrying Zhai Zhigang, commander, Wang Yaping and Ye Guagfu, operators, on their second, second and first spaceflight respectively. Their mission duration onboard the TSS is 6 months, the longest so far in Chinese spaceflight.

entry.title: Starship S20 Static Fire
entry.content: SpaceX will perform a static fire of the Starship S20 vehicle between 22:00 and 5:00 UTC (5pm-midnight CDT).

entry.title: NASA Lucy Pre-Launch News Conference
entry.content: NASA will host a media briefing about the upcoming launch of the Lucy mission. Lucy will explore multiple asteroids over the course of 12 years.
